trans-unit.source: How to Manage Expiration of Cloud Service Content in the Azure Content Delivery Network (CDN)
trans-unit.target: How to Manage Expiration of Cloud Service Content in the Azure Content Delivery Network (CDN)

trans-unit.source: Objects that benefit the most from Azure CDN caching are those that are accessed frequently during their time-to-live (TTL) period.
trans-unit.target: Objects that benefit the most from Azure CDN caching are those that are accessed frequently during their time-to-live (TTL) period.

trans-unit.source: An object stays in the cache for the TTL period and then is refreshed from the cloud service after that time is elapsed.
trans-unit.target: An object stays in the cache for the TTL period and then is refreshed from the cloud service after that time is elapsed.

trans-unit.source: If you do not provide cache values, the TTL of an object is 7 days.
trans-unit.target: If you do not provide cache values, the TTL of an object is 7 days.

trans-unit.source: For static content such as images and style sheets you can control the update frequency by including a web.config in the CDN folder containing the content and modifying the clientCache settings to control the Cache-Control header for your content.
trans-unit.target: For static content such as images and style sheets you can control the update frequency by including a web.config in the CDN folder containing the content and modifying the clientCache settings to control the Cache-Control header for your content.

trans-unit.source: The web.config settings will affect everything in the folder and all subfolders, unless overridden in another subfolder further down.
trans-unit.target: The web.config settings will affect everything in the folder and all subfolders, unless overridden in another subfolder further down.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can set a default time-to-live at the root to have all static content cached for 3 days, but have a subfolder that has more variable content with a cache setting of 6 hours.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can set a default time-to-live at the root to have all static content cached for 3 days, but have a subfolder that has more variable content with a cache setting of 6 hours.

trans-unit.source: The following XML shows and example of setting clientCache to specify a maximum age of 3 days:
trans-unit.target: The following XML shows and example of setting clientCache to specify a maximum age of 3 days:

trans-unit.source: Specifying UseMaxAge adds a Cache-Control: max-age= header to the response based on the value specified in the CacheControlMaxAge attribute. The format of the timespan is for the cacheControlMaxAge attribute is .::. For more information on the clientCache node, see Client Cache .
trans-unit.target: Specifying UseMaxAge adds a Cache-Control: max-age= header to the response based on the value specified in the CacheControlMaxAge attribute. The format of the timespan is for the cacheControlMaxAge attribute is .::. For more information on the clientCache node, see Client Cache .

trans-unit.source: For content returned from applications such as .aspx pages, you can set the CDN caching behavior programmatically by setting the HttpResponse.Cache property.
trans-unit.target: For content returned from applications such as .aspx pages, you can set the CDN caching behavior programmatically by setting the HttpResponse.Cache property.

trans-unit.source: For more information on the HttpResponse.Cache property, see HttpResponse.Cache Property and HttpCachePolicy Class.
trans-unit.target: For more information on the HttpResponse.Cache property, see HttpResponse.Cache Property and HttpCachePolicy Class.

trans-unit.source: If you want to programmatically cache application content, make sure that the content is marked as cacheable by setting HttpCacheability to Public.
trans-unit.target: If you want to programmatically cache application content, make sure that the content is marked as cacheable by setting HttpCacheability to Public.

trans-unit.source: Also, ensure that a cache validator is set.
trans-unit.target: Also, ensure that a cache validator is set.

trans-unit.source: The cache validator can be a Last Modified timestamp set by calling SetLastModified, or an etag value set by calling SetETag.
trans-unit.target: The cache validator can be a Last Modified timestamp set by calling SetLastModified, or an etag value set by calling SetETag.

trans-unit.source: Optionally, you can also specify a cache expiration time by calling SetExpires, or you can rely on the default cache heuristics described earlier in this document.
trans-unit.target: Optionally, you can also specify a cache expiration time by calling SetExpires, or you can rely on the default cache heuristics described earlier in this document.

trans-unit.source: For example, to cache content for one hour, add the following:
trans-unit.target: For example, to cache content for one hour, add the following:
